article: on the eve of world war ii , curators at the louvre swathed the museum 's most priceless painting -- the `` mona lisa '' -- in layers of waterproof paper , boxed it up and spirited it to the french countryside for safekeeping .
abstract: new exhibition documents louvre during wwii
